item.title: AMD ROCm vs HIP SDK
item.description: Source ROCm vs HIP SDK ROCm is AMD’s “open-source platform for GPU computing” w/ a particular focus on HPC (High-Performance Computing) and AI. HIP SDK is a small subset of the ROCm intiative: the focus of enabling conversion of CUDA-specific applications to portable apps which work across AMD & NVIDIA.
item.content:
Source

ROCm vs HIP SDK

ROCm is AMD’s “open-source platform for GPU computing” w/ a particular focus on HPC (High-Performance Computing) and AI.

HIP SDK is a small subset of the ROCm intiative: the focus of enabling conversion of CUDA-specific applications to portable apps which work across AMD & NVIDIA.

item.title: Ancient Sumerians
item.description: Historical West-Asian region situated roughly around today’s Iraq and parts of Iran, Syria, Kuwait, & Turkey. People slept on their rooftops, due to excessive heat Uruk (first large city in the Mesopotamia) Epic of Gilgamesh (Uruk King) https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Epic_of_Gilgamesh
item.content:
Historical West-Asian region situated roughly around today’s Iraq and parts of Iran, Syria, Kuwait, & Turkey.

  • People slept on their rooftops, due to excessive heat
  • Uruk (first large city in the Mesopotamia)
  • Epic of Gilgamesh (Uruk King)
  • https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Epic_of_Gilgamesh

item.title: BBQ Sauce Ratios
item.description: “Red” Tomato-based BBQ Sauce Per 6 servings: 1/2 cup Tomato Sauce ~1 Tbsp of acidity (e.g. vinegars) ~2 Tbsp of sweet (e.g. brown sugar, molasses) ~1-3 Tbsp of spicy (e.g. hot sauce) Seasoning (warm, earthy + salt) Korean BBQ Sauce Per 14 servings: 3/4 cup sweet 3/4 cup low-sodium umami (soy sauce, worcestershire, …) 1/4 cup water 1 1/2 Tbsp spice (chili paste, hot sauce, etc.) 1 Tbsp acidity (e.g. rice wine vinegar) Seasoning (warm, earthy, spicy) 1 Tbsp cornstarch (any thickening agent) 1 Tbsp water (thickening agent activator)
item.content:
“Red” Tomato-based BBQ Sauce

Per 6 servings:

  • 1/2 cup Tomato Sauce
  • ~1 Tbsp of acidity (e.g. vinegars)
  • ~2 Tbsp of sweet (e.g. brown sugar, molasses)
  • ~1-3 Tbsp of spicy (e.g. hot sauce)
  • Seasoning (warm, earthy + salt)

Korean BBQ Sauce

Per 14 servings:

  • 3/4 cup sweet
  • 3/4 cup low-sodium umami (soy sauce, worcestershire, …)
  • 1/4 cup water
  • 1 1/2 Tbsp spice (chili paste, hot sauce, etc.)
  • 1 Tbsp acidity (e.g. rice wine vinegar)
  • Seasoning (warm, earthy, spicy)
  • 1 Tbsp cornstarch (any thickening agent)
  • 1 Tbsp water (thickening agent activator)

item.title: Bromelain (Pineapple Enzyme)
item.description: Common Names: bromelain, pineapple enzyme, pineapple extract Latin Names: (pineapple plant) Ananas comosus What is it? Group of enzymes which can be found in the stem and fruit of a pineapple Medicinal Usages: Dietary Supplement which can assist w/ pain & swelling Especially the gut, mouth, & nasal regions after an injury or surgery Potentially helpful w/ side-effects of osteoarthritis, cancer, digestive problems, and muscle soreness Topical bromelain can be used to assist w/ burn healing Several studies1 show the benefits of using bromelain to remove dead skin after a burn References Rosenberg L, Krieger Y, Bogdanov-Berezovski A, et al.
item.content:
Common Names: bromelain, pineapple enzyme, pineapple extract Latin Names: (pineapple plant) Ananas comosus

What is it?

  • Group of enzymes which can be found in the stem and fruit of a pineapple
  • Medicinal Usages:
    • Dietary Supplement which can assist w/ pain & swelling
      • Especially the gut, mouth, & nasal regions after an injury or surgery
      • Potentially helpful w/ side-effects of osteoarthritis, cancer, digestive problems, and muscle soreness
    • Topical bromelain can be used to assist w/ burn healing
      • Several studies1 show the benefits of using bromelain to remove dead skin after a burn

References

  1. Rosenberg L, Krieger Y, Bogdanov-Berezovski A, et al. A novel rapid and selective enzymatic debridement agent for burn wound management: a multi-center RCT. Burns. 2014;40(3):466-474. ↩︎

item.title: Business Tips (Tweets)
item.description: Loom Lead Magnet (Greg Isenberg) No one talks about this but you can use Loom as a “lead magnet” in 10 minutes or less: Record a Loom jam packed with value Request email to view loom Share Loom link on social or paid ads Get thousands of emails You now know there’s demand for your product https://x.com/gregisenberg/status/1751618325208007046?s=46&t=wzJBGH_k-cdpzRzQDCggLA Engineering + Product-Minded i talk a lot about how engineers should be more product minded
item.content:
Loom Lead Magnet (Greg Isenberg)

No one talks about this but you can use Loom as a “lead magnet” in 10 minutes or less:

  1. Record a Loom jam packed with value
  2. Request email to view loom
  3. Share Loom link on social or paid ads
  4. Get thousands of emails
  5. You now know there’s demand for your product

https://x.com/gregisenberg/status/1751618325208007046?s=46&t=wzJBGH_k-cdpzRzQDCggLA

Engineering + Product-Minded

i talk a lot about how engineers should be more product minded

realizing the reverse can work too - product minded people need to go into the deepest parts of engineering

so many of our tools lack taste, simplicity and optimize for things that don’t matter

https://x.com/thdxr/status/1763376813655417252?s=46&t=wzJBGH_k-cdpzRzQDCggLA

Personal Q: What is the median of those two?

item.title: Databases
item.description: ScyllaDB Website Marketing: “ScyllaDB’s close-to-the-metal architecture handles millions of OPS with predictable single-digit millisecond latencies.” Wide Column vs Document Sources: https://lp.scylladb.com/scylladb-mongodb-comparison.pdf https://www.scylladb.com/glossary/wide-column-database/ Data Model: “MongoDB applies a JSON based document data model, ScyllaDB a wide-column data model.” Apache Cassandra Marketing: “Manage massive amounts of data, fast, without losing sleep” MongoDB Marketing: “You don’t need a separate database to support transactions, rich search, or genAI. The world’s most popular document database is now the world’s most versatile developer data platform.
item.content:
ScyllaDB

Website

  • Marketing: “ScyllaDB’s close-to-the-metal architecture handles millions of OPS with predictable single-digit millisecond latencies.”
  • Wide Column vs Document
    • Sources:
      • https://lp.scylladb.com/scylladb-mongodb-comparison.pdf
      • https://www.scylladb.com/glossary/wide-column-database/
    • Data Model: “MongoDB applies a JSON based document data model, ScyllaDB a wide-column data model.”

Apache Cassandra

  • Marketing: “Manage massive amounts of data, fast, without losing sleep”

MongoDB

  • Marketing: “You don’t need a separate database to support transactions, rich search, or genAI. The world’s most popular document database is now the world’s most versatile developer data platform.”

Amazon DynamoDB

  • Marketing: “Serverless, NoSQL, fully managed database with single-digit millisecond performance at any scale”

Apache CouchDB

  • Marketing: “Seamless multi-master sync, that scales from Big Data to Mobile, with an intuitive HTTP/JSON API and designed for Reliability.” (Another big one: “Relax”)

Neo4j

  • Marketing: “Power your applications with knowledge graphs. Backed by the only graph database with vector search.”

Elasticsearch

  • Marketing: “Elasticsearch is a distributed, RESTful search and analytics engine capable of addressing a growing number of use cases. As the heart of the Elastic Stack, it centrally stores your data for lightning fast search, fine‑tuned relevancy, and powerful analytics that scale with ease.”

Solr

  • Marketing: “Solr is the popular, blazing-fast, open source enterprise search platform built on Apache Lucene”

Riak®

Riak® KV

  • Marketing: “Riak® KV is a distributed NoSQL key-value database with advanced local and multi-cluster replication that guarantees reads and writes even in the event of hardware failures or network partitions.”

Riak® TS

  • Marketing: “Riak® TS is the only enterprise-grade NoSQL time series database optimized specifically for IoT and Time Series data. It ingests, transforms, stores, and analyzes massive amounts of time series data. Riak TS is engineered to be faster than Cassandra.”

Couchbase

Memcached

Hazelcast

Aerospike

  • Marketing: “Aerospike is a distributed NoSQL database with blazing-fast reads/writes and unmatched uptime. Start building real-time apps in minutes with our fully managed DBaaS.”

ArangoDB

  • Marketing: “The Most Complete And Scalable Graph Database For Real-world Use Cases”

OrientDB

RethinkDB

InfluxDB

Redis

item.title: Foundation Models
item.description: A type of ML model that is trained on a broad dataset. These models are generally used for general or broad use cases, and may be adaptable through fine-tuning. Foundation models like the ones powering OpenAI’s ChatGPT, can cost hundreds of millions of dollars to train. The term was coined in Aug. 2021 at Stanford. —— Foundation models are near universally based on Transformers.
item.content:
A type of ML model that is trained on a broad dataset. These models are generally used for general or broad use cases, and may be adaptable through fine-tuning.

Foundation models like the ones powering OpenAI’s ChatGPT, can cost hundreds of millions of dollars to train.

The term was coined in Aug. 2021 at Stanford.

——

Foundation models are near universally based on Transformers.

item.title: FreeCAD 3D Printing Notes
item.description: Avoiding Common Pitfalls Always ensure that 3D objects are solid PartDesign Workbench will notify you of any operations that would prevent the model from staying solid. Part Workbench has a Check Geometry tool, which can check for further defects Ensure your dimensions align properly Dimensions are vital: 1 millimeter in FreeCAD is 1 millimeter in real life Control degradation of the model, during transformation w/ the slicer (FreeCAD file -> a G-Code dialect) No printer will be able to directly create a 1:1 replica of the 3D object.
item.content:
Avoiding Common Pitfalls

  • Always ensure that 3D objects are solid
    • PartDesign Workbench will notify you of any operations that would prevent the model from staying solid.
    • Part Workbench has a Check Geometry tool, which can check for further defects
  • Ensure your dimensions align properly
    • Dimensions are vital: 1 millimeter in FreeCAD is 1 millimeter in real life
  • Control degradation of the model, during transformation w/ the slicer (FreeCAD file -> a G-Code dialect)
    • No printer will be able to directly create a 1:1 replica of the 3D object. Some bit of degradation in quality will occur, ensuring that this stays above your ideal threshold is a necessity.

General Workflow Overview

  1. Model your object within FreeCAD, ensuring to avoid the common pitfalls
  2. Convert your 3D model -> mesh
  3. “Slice” the mesh
  4. Generate G-Code

Useful Links

Preparing Models for 3D Printing: https://wiki.freecad.org/Manual:Preparing_models_for_3D_printing

item.title: Grafana + Prometheus + Loki
item.description: Grafana Grafana open source software enables you to query, visualize, alert on, and explore your metrics, logs, and traces wherever they are stored. Grafana OSS provides you with tools to turn your time-series database (TSDB) data into insightful graphs and visualizations. Grafana proper does not provide any form of time-series database, nor does it provide any other data sources out of the box. Prometheus
item.content:
Grafana

Grafana open source software enables you to query, visualize, alert on, and explore your metrics, logs, and traces wherever they are stored. Grafana OSS provides you with tools to turn your time-series database (TSDB) data into insightful graphs and visualizations.

Grafana proper does not provide any form of time-series database, nor does it provide any other data sources out of the box.

Prometheus

item.title: Hyrum’s Law
item.description: With a sufficient number of users of an API, it does not matter what you promise in the contract: all observable behaviors of your system will be depended on by somebody. Source
item.content:
With a sufficient number of users of an API,
it does not matter what you promise in the contract:
all observable behaviors of your system
will be depended on by somebody.

Source

item.title: Just-In-Time vs Just-In-Case
item.description: The difference between just-in-case and just-in-time is like the difference between training and trying. Person A never learned Algebra and never uses it. Person B learned Algebra in grade school and uses it daily. It would be hard to learn Algebra just in time. And the likelihood that Person B would use Algebra, if they had not learned it, is slim-to-nil What is the perfect balance of Just-In-Time learning vs Just-In-Case?
item.content:
• The difference between just-in-case and just-in-time is like the difference between training and trying.
  • Person A never learned Algebra and never uses it. Person B learned Algebra in grade school and uses it daily.
    • It would be hard to learn Algebra just in time. And the likelihood that Person B would use Algebra, if they had not learned it, is slim-to-nil

What is the perfect balance of Just-In-Time learning vs Just-In-Case? Is a difficult question to answer.

One cannot simply learn something Just-In-Time if they do not know a solution or problem exists.

Source: https://www.johndcook.com/blog/2010/03/03/just-in-case-versus-just-in-time/

item.title: Mutual Funds vs ETFs
item.description: Mutual Funds are actively managed by a fund manager or a full team (though passively managed fund have a bit of popularity) ETFs are always passively managed Mutual Funds generally have a minimum investment amount (e.g. in the $500 - $5,000 min range) ETFs are bought and sold like stock and therefore are bought & sold similarly. They can even be shorted Mutual Funds will almost always have much higher expenses, especially due to them being actively managed.
item.content:
• Mutual Funds are actively managed by a fund manager or a full team (though passively managed fund have a bit of popularity)

  • ETFs are always passively managed

  • Mutual Funds generally have a minimum investment amount (e.g. in the $500 - $5,000 min range)

  • ETFs are bought and sold like stock and therefore are bought & sold similarly. They can even be shorted

  • Mutual Funds will almost always have much higher expenses, especially due to them being actively managed. The expenses can go towards many things like: paying the fund manager(s), paying for marketing, and more

  • Mutual Funds will buy and sell stocks and securities as a proxy for you

  • ETFs generally track a market index or sector sub-index

item.title: Practical Electronics For Inventors
item.description: Definitions (A) ampere or amp (p6) Unit of current Interchangeable unit for 1 C/s (C) coulomb (p6) Unit of electrical charge Voltage potential difference or just potential (NOT potential energy) (V) volt (p14) Unit of measure of Voltage 1 volt = 1 joule / 1 coulomb Power (p14) power = dW/dt Chapter 2: Theory Voltage To get a mental image of how a battery generates an EMF through a circuit, we envision that chemical reactions inside yield free electrons that quickly build in number within the negative terminal region (anode material), causing an electron concentration.
item.content:
Definitions

  • (A) ampere or amp (p6)
    • Unit of current
    • Interchangeable unit for 1 C/s
  • (C) coulomb (p6)
    • Unit of electrical charge
  • Voltage
    • potential difference or just potential (NOT potential energy)
  • (V) volt (p14)
    • Unit of measure of Voltage
    • 1 volt = 1 joule / 1 coulomb
  • Power (p14)
    • power = dW/dt

Chapter 2: Theory

Voltage

To get a mental image of how a battery generates an EMF through a circuit, we envision that chemical reactions inside yield free electrons that quickly build in number within the negative terminal region (anode material), causing an electron concentration. This concentration is full of repulsive force (electrons repel) that can be viewed as a kind of “electrical pressure”

With a load (e.g., flashlight lamp, …) placed between the battery’s terminals, electrons from the battery’s negative terminal attempt to alleviate this pressure by dispersing into the circuit. These electrons increase the concentration of free electrons within the end of the conductor attached to the negative terminal. Even a small percentage difference in free electron concentration in one region gives rise to great repulsive forces between free electrons. (p11) 2.3.1 The Mechanisms of Voltage

item.title: Staff Engineering Archetypes
item.description: Source Tech Lead Focus on partnering with a small amount of Engineering Managers (1-3 generally) Guides approach and execution of technical bits, generally in a focused area Tech Lead Manager may also exists, but is on the Engineering Manager track (not Staff-plus) Architect Combines technical prowess and organizational leadership knowledge to guide direction, quality, and execution in critical paths Solver Digs very deep into arbitrarily difficult or complex problem areas Very strong technical skills are necessary Can focus on a specific area for an extended amount of time, or can jump between “hotspots” Right Hand Generally only present in very large organizations Acts as an extension to an executive, providing additional processing/bandwidth Generally acts on the scope and authority of whom they’re assisting
item.content:
Source

Tech Lead

  • Focus on partnering with a small amount of Engineering Managers (1-3 generally)
  • Guides approach and execution of technical bits, generally in a focused area
  • Tech Lead Manager may also exists, but is on the Engineering Manager track (not Staff-plus)

Architect

  • Combines technical prowess and organizational leadership knowledge to guide direction, quality, and execution in critical paths

Solver

  • Digs very deep into arbitrarily difficult or complex problem areas
  • Very strong technical skills are necessary
  • Can focus on a specific area for an extended amount of time, or can jump between “hotspots”

Right Hand

  • Generally only present in very large organizations
  • Acts as an extension to an executive, providing additional processing/bandwidth
  • Generally acts on the scope and authority of whom they’re assisting

item.title: Startup Funding
item.description: ▪︎ TinySeed is an alternative to the usual Venture Capital funding ▪︎ Even raising $100k is considered semi-bootstrapping ▪︎ Finding Angel Investors or other low investment options are better for 90+% of startups
item.content: ▪︎ TinySeed is an alternative to the usual Venture Capital funding ▪︎ Even raising $100k is considered semi-bootstrapping ▪︎ Finding Angel Investors or other low investment options are better for 90+% of startups

item.title: Startup Ideas
item.description: SISP - Solution In Search of a Problem Tar Pit Ideas - Ideas that seem tantalizing, and are theoretically easy to solve. However, you will get stuck for months or years trying to solve the problem. (Social Media Co. trying to consolidate communication) Q1) Is/are the founder(s) fit for the market? Q2) How large is the market? Q3) How accute is this problem? (Care of the problem, for consumers of your product)
item.content:
SISP - Solution In Search of a Problem

Tar Pit Ideas - Ideas that seem tantalizing, and are theoretically easy to solve. However, you will get stuck for months or years trying to solve the problem. (Social Media Co. trying to consolidate communication)

Q1) Is/are the founder(s) fit for the market?

Q2) How large is the market?

Q3) How accute is this problem? (Care of the problem, for consumers of your product)

Q4) Do you have competition? (Good)

Q5) Did it recently become possible?

Q6) Are there any proxy businesses that can proven your idea?

Q7) Is this a problem you want to work on for years?

Q8) Is this a scalable business?

Q9) Is this a good idea space? A good idea space is one which has a good hit rate of success.

item.title: Transformers
item.description: What is it? A deep learning architecture which is based on multi-head attention. Transformers were introduced to the world through a 2017 paper by eight scientists at Google: “Attention Is All You Need”. A paper which is seen as the turning point of modern artificial intelligence. Why was it created? Previously, ML architectures such as recurrent architectures, long short-term memory took much longer to train. Transformers enabled more efficient training, and by proxy made possible the wave of LLMs (Large Language Models) we have access to today.
item.content:
What is it?

A deep learning architecture which is based on multi-head attention.

Transformers were introduced to the world through a 2017 paper by eight scientists at Google: “Attention Is All You Need”. A paper which is seen as the turning point of modern artificial intelligence.

Why was it created?

Previously, ML architectures such as recurrent architectures, long short-term memory took much longer to train.

Transformers enabled more efficient training, and by proxy made possible the wave of LLMs (Large Language Models) we have access to today.

item.title: Triangle Trigonometric Functions
item.description: Sine Right Triangles sin(θ) = opposite / hypotenuse Non-Right Triangle a / sin(A) = b / sin(B) = c / sin(C) Cosine Right Triangle cos(θ) = adjacent / hypotenuse Tangent Right Triangle tan(θ) = opposite / adjacent
item.content:
Sine

Right Triangles

  • sin(θ) = opposite / hypotenuse

Non-Right Triangle

  • a / sin(A) = b / sin(B) = c / sin(C)

Cosine

Right Triangle

  • cos(θ) = adjacent / hypotenuse

Tangent

Right Triangle

  • tan(θ) = opposite / adjacent
